subject: Volume: remove a useless `_delete_volume_type` alias
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-26 10:36:31.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volume_types.py'], 'message': 'Volume: remove a useless `_delete_volume_type` alias

We shouldn"t allow people to alias client methods like this. It gives
a bad opinion on Tempest code base: lack of consistency, code harder
to read (because you constently have to switch between test code and
methods definition).

Change-Id: Ic52159ad72246cc5d8fc5ef3bb7877b8b8d8821b
'}]
commit_message:
Volume: remove a useless `_delete_volume_type` alias

We shouldn"t allow people to alias client methods like this. It gives
a bad opinion on Tempest code base: lack of consistency, code harder
to read (because you constently have to switch between test code and
methods definition).

Change-Id: Ic52159ad72246cc5d8fc5ef3bb7877b8b8d8821b

commit_message:
Enable sorting and pagination in -api gate

There is a plan to get those enabled by default in next cycles. For
that, we should first ensure that test coverage for the feature is
decent. Sadly, there are currently no API tests for those features

all. So the first step is to enable those optional features in -api

After that, we can start working on test coverage in tre tree. Once

get to the point when we are sure coverage is good enough, we can
proceed with the plan to enable it by default for all operators.

Related-Bug: #1566514
Change-Id: I94177604b4ac3f8b42521e2231f10363fe8e4483

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 13:48:45.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Require iso8601>=0.1.11

python-openstacksdk uses "iso8601.UTC" which does not work in
iso8601 version 0.1.9. Running python-openstacksdk tests with 0.1.9
on python 2.7 fails with:

AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'UTC'

Change-Id: I0282763a6c563277d9b176920e0dec2e07512100
'}]
commit_message:
Require iso8601>=0.1.11

python-openstacksdk uses "iso8601.UTC" which does not work in
iso8601 version 0.1.9. Running python-openstacksdk tests with 0.1.9
on python 2.7 fails with:

AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'UTC'

Change-Id: I0282763a6c563277d9b176920e0dec2e07512100

subject: Preserve Swift paths that start with '/'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-30 15:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['os_loganalyze/generator.py'], 'message': "Preserve Swift paths that start with '/'

Objects uploaded to Swift can start with '/', so we should not strip it
out of the Swift path.  We can temporarily strip it out of the log_name
when calculating the safe path (which is the path on disk we're looking
for).

Change-Id: I25031f2c1be91c9f82b17a15f3ee4bdf07303cb8
"}]
commit_message:
Preserve Swift paths that start with '/'

Objects uploaded to Swift can start with '/', so we should not strip it
out of the Swift path.  We can temporarily strip it out of the log_name
when calculating the safe path (which is the path on disk we're looking
for).

Change-Id: I25031f2c1be91c9f82b17a15f3ee4bdf07303cb8

Default values are too low in case new test cases want to create more of
their own resources. Sadly, tempest took a cleanup path where test cases
do not clean after themselves, instead postponing it to test suite
completion.  It would be more in line with other projects relying on
tempest framework just to bump quotas and wait for the next time we need
to bump them.

Change-Id: I01ffc4ad485dff299dab4e3f49d2dcc0e950fc44
'}]
commit_message:
gate: bump resource quotas x10 times

Default values are too low in case new test cases want to create more of
their own resources. Sadly, tempest took a cleanup path where test cases
do not clean after themselves, instead postponing it to test suite
completion.  It would be more in line with other projects relying on
tempest framework just to bump quotas and wait for the next time we need
to bump them.

Change-Id: I01ffc4ad485dff299dab4e3f49d2dcc0e950fc44

subject: Remove experimental nova-v20-api-legacy job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-29 22:42:52.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove experimental nova-v20-api-legacy job

There are two implementation code for similar API in Nova repository.
One is newer: v2.1 API, another is legacy: v2 API. v2.1 API has been
used as the default API since Liberty and legacy v2 API has been marked
as deprecated.
We have used and tested v2.1 API so well and now is nice time to remove
legacy API code based on the consensus of the design summit of Austin.

This patch removes experimental job for legacy API code.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: Iac81b7d569b76b99e9d86eaa5001ae7f9b78cdfe
'}]
commit_message:
Remove experimental nova-v20-api-legacy job

There are two implementation code for similar API in Nova repository.
One is newer: v2.1 API, another is legacy: v2 API. v2.1 API has been
used as the default API since Liberty and legacy v2 API has been marked
as deprecated.
We have used and tested v2.1 API so well and now is nice time to remove
legacy API code based on the consensus of the design summit of Austin.

This patch removes experimental job for legacy API code.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: Iac81b7d569b76b99e9d86eaa5001ae7f9b78cdfe

subject: Enhance Neutron OVS native jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-30 01:16:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/neutron.yaml'], 'message': 'Enhance Neutron OVS native jobs

In order to consider switching to native interfaces to
OVS (i.e. using Ryu/OVS Python IDL libraries rather than
shelling out with rootwrap), we need to start watching
these jobs to see how they perform. Before doing that,
we need both native interfaces to be enabled.

Change-Id: I252902d0a0debe6fae4d023cd118ef20f15b47d9
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance Neutron OVS native jobs

In order to consider switching to native interfaces to
OVS (i.e. using Ryu/OVS Python IDL libraries rather than
shelling out with rootwrap), we need to start watching
these jobs to see how they perform. Before doing that,
we need both native interfaces to be enabled.

Change-Id: I252902d0a0debe6fae4d023cd118ef20f15b47d9

The change being reverted broke out of tree virt drivers
without any deprecation cycle, which we at least did with the
manager plugins and other plug-points in Mitaka.

We should at least provide a deprecation cycle so the out of
tree virt drivers can have time to adjust to this.

Change-Id: If70842863b1991485c0464f01b3568bf31166161

commit_message:
Revert "remove the use of import_object_ns"

This reverts commit 8eb03de1eb83a6cd2d4d41804e1b8253f94e5400.

The change being reverted broke out of tree virt drivers
without any deprecation cycle, which we at least did with the
manager plugins and other plug-points in Mitaka.

We should at least provide a deprecation cycle so the out of
tree virt drivers can have time to adjust to this.

Change-Id: If70842863b1991485c0464f01b3568bf31166161

commit_message:
libvirt: remove version checks for hyperv PV features

The hyperv paravirt features requires libvirt 1.1.0 and QEMU
1.1.0 which are both older than our min required versions.
Thus we can remove the versions checks for the hyperv
paravirt features.

Change-Id: Iff6a4557515294fe6856e53a368870c5fff79c96

commit_message:
libvirt: remove version checks for block job handling

The volume snapshot code requires libvirt 1.1.1 in order
to get a fix for block job handling, which is older than
our min required libvirt version. Thus we can remove the
version checks for this feature.

Change-Id: I59647b995b9243a290d2290142f025a686f84832

subject: Remove unneeded default arg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-30 06:38:57.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/controllers.py'], 'message': "Remove unneeded default arg

In the CreateNetwork libnetwork endpoint impl, the
function utils.make_net_name passes unneeded default
argument tags=app.tag, but since make_net_name is not
dependent on whether tag support is enabled or not, we
don't need it. This patch simply removes that default
arg.

Change-Id: Ieb557b3dc2ce0b84678dadf36b7b81661d64db07
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded default arg

In the CreateNetwork libnetwork endpoint impl, the
function utils.make_net_name passes unneeded default
argument tags=app.tag, but since make_net_name is not
dependent on whether tag support is enabled or not, we
don't need it. This patch simply removes that default
arg.

Change-Id: Ieb557b3dc2ce0b84678dadf36b7b81661d64db07

commit_message:
Add filter function on resource type table

Resource Types panel in Orchestration panel group has a resources
type table. This table does not have a filter function even though
the number of colums is over 90.
This patch add a filter function to this table.

Change-Id: I66e950b1acc3d9ea70fff5545cc0cc7fce6fa500
Closes-bug: #1569681

subject: Fix revert migration if flavor deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-29 22:24:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix revert migration if flavor deleted

After an instance is created, the flavor could be deleted.  But
operations still need to be able to occur against the VM when that
occurs.  A new test in Tempest showed that we had been using the
incorrect (and potentially deleted) flavor when a resize/migration was
reverting.

This change updates the code to use the flavor that is stored on the
instance itself.

Change-Id: I16254d8eb74a724e3e0a538f47259e9627c4233a
Closes-Bug: 1570748
'}]
commit_message:
Fix revert migration if flavor deleted

After an instance is created, the flavor could be deleted.  But
operations still need to be able to occur against the VM when that
occurs.  A new test in Tempest showed that we had been using the
incorrect (and potentially deleted) flavor when a resize/migration was
reverting.

This change updates the code to use the flavor that is stored on the
instance itself.

Change-Id: I16254d8eb74a724e3e0a538f47259e9627c4233a
Closes-Bug: 1570748

commit_message:
libvirt: remove version checks for live snapshot feature

The live snapshot feature requires libvirt 1.0.0 and QEMU 1.3.0
which are both older than our minimum required versions. Thus we
can remove the version checks for this feature.

Change-Id: I22d7545ec9d073498b070de274f5a58e32c80df5

commit_message:
Support local_id configuration

In some case, we want to specify the local id instead of use the
external ip. For example, the router is behind NAT, and we don't
want to expose this IP to peer. This patch will make local_id
configurable. Most often, local id would be domain name, email
address etc. But if local id is not configured then external ip
will still be used as the leftid.

Note: this change is DocImpact & APIImpact

Change-Id: I2433d72ba22ce410cbfafb7b8bfb16f51eefdfc1
Closes-Bug: #1513353

When running cluster-create, the CLI prints the instances created as

commit_message:
Fixed output of cluster-create in CLI

When running cluster-create, the CLI prints the instances created as
part of the output.  This causes the results to scroll off the screen
and makes it very difficult to see what happened.

The output of cluster-create has been consolidated with that of
cluster-show, in much the same way as is done with create and show
for single instances.

Change-Id: Id4eecc236b6c1ec43b47714ac5eabd8323a5b996
Closes-Bug: #1563504

commit_message:
libvirt: increase min required libvirt to 1.2.1

As advertized during Mitaka, increase the min required
libvirt version to 1.2.1.

At this time there is no new "next" version planned.
The need to advertize a version increase for Ocata
will be decided later.

Change-Id: Ib73cfbd9fc01114ac513730d182ed127710a9e5d

commit_message:
libvirt: remove version checks for libvirt disk discard feature

The disk backing file discard support requires libvirt 1.0.6
which is older than our min required libvirt versiron. Thus we
can remove the libvirt version checks for this feature.

Change-Id: I034469b86a7cd839b6099b55e484da8060ce02a2

subject: new_release: fixed error handling when opening deliverable file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-21 18:50:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/new_release.py'], 'message': "new_release: fixed error handling when opening deliverable file

argparse parser object does not have .abort(), so the script fails with
AttributeError stacktrace if e.g. the file does not exist.

The intention of the original author was to call .error() so that's what
we now use here.

Change-Id: I71fc86251b7a48504e4ffcf1f0d715feb96141ab
"}]
commit_message:
new_release: fixed error handling when opening deliverable file

argparse parser object does not have .abort(), so the script fails with
AttributeError stacktrace if e.g. the file does not exist.

The intention of the original author was to call .error() so that's what
we now use here.

Change-Id: I71fc86251b7a48504e4ffcf1f0d715feb96141ab

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-26 16:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'releasenotes/notes/min-required-qemu-c987a8a5c6c4fee0.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: add explicit check for min required QEMU version

Previously Nova only checked the minimum required libvirt
version. It should also be checking for a minimum required
QEMU version.

This picks QEMU version 1.5.3, since that is the oldest
QEMU version that exists in the distros that include
the minimum libvirt version 1.2.1.

No decision is made about a "next" QEMU version at this
time.

Change-Id: Ie9413338a2422cc876f48c5c477eb3cd0ffb13ec
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: add explicit check for min required QEMU version

Previously Nova only checked the minimum required libvirt
version. It should also be checking for a minimum required
QEMU version.

This picks QEMU version 1.5.3, since that is the oldest
QEMU version that exists in the distros that include
the minimum libvirt version 1.2.1.

No decision is made about a "next" QEMU version at this
time.

Change-Id: Ie9413338a2422cc876f48c5c477eb3cd0ffb13ec

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 13562, 'name': 'Samuel Matzek', 'email': 'smatzek@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'smatzek'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-29 20:07:03.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add req to pycrypto to fix import errors

We're not sure...

But we think paramiko's recent 2.0.0 release somehow breaks a
requirement chain where *somebody* needs pycrypto and is no longer
getting it.  Adding the requirement for pycrypto (synced with the
corresponding global requirement) resolves the tox errors seen in the
bug report.

And the gate wasn't failing because... the pycrypto req was being picked
up some other way.

Change-Id: I1286b7df7df6608a2fdb929eb55f2d6fbfd031ea
Closes-Bug: 1576822
"}]
commit_message:
Add req to pycrypto to fix import errors

We're not sure...

But we think paramiko's recent 2.0.0 release somehow breaks a
requirement chain where *somebody* needs pycrypto and is no longer
getting it.  Adding the requirement for pycrypto (synced with the
corresponding global requirement) resolves the tox errors seen in the
bug report.

And the gate wasn't failing because... the pycrypto req was being picked
up some other way.

Change-Id: I1286b7df7df6608a2fdb929eb55f2d6fbfd031ea
Closes-Bug: 1576822

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-30 00:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add spec-cleaner to list of global-requirements

spec-cleaner is a program to enforce a specfic style for
RPM .spec files. It's similar to pep8 for python code, but
spec-cleaner doesn't have a specification. The library is
only used for testing and is not needed while running any
OpenStack component.

The rpm-packaging project.

Yes. It's available on https://github.com/openSUSE/spec-cleaner and
a couple of different people are working on it. The module as also
a big unittest suite.

Change-Id: I41ebffcb6646c3c44e469f6393a1aef86bcd927e

commit_message:
Add spec-cleaner to list of global-requirements

spec-cleaner is a program to enforce a specfic style for
RPM .spec files. It's similar to pep8 for python code, but
spec-cleaner doesn't have a specification. The library is
only used for testing and is not needed while running any
OpenStack component.

The rpm-packaging project.

Yes. It's available on https://github.com/openSUSE/spec-cleaner and
a couple of different people are working on it. The module as also
a big unittest suite.

Available and also tested with unittests.

Yes. It's BSD licensed.

Change-Id: I41ebffcb6646c3c44e469f6393a1aef86bcd927e

subject: treat alarm id as name if it is not uuid like
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-26 13:18:15.000000000', 'files': ['aodhclient/tests/functional/test_alarm.py', 'aodhclient/v2/alarm_cli.py'], 'message': 'treat alarm id as name if it is not uuid like

We can specify alarm name to do alarm {show, update, delete}, but
need to explicitly use --alarm-name, which seems not so convenient.

This patch adds a check for postional argument, if it is UUID like,
we treat it as alarm id, if not, we treat it as name.

However, there is a rare case that a name can be UUID like as well,
command will fail with 404 and people will treat it as a bug. We
can do an extra request for 404 error to try to use the value as
name, but it will sacrifice normal 404 case for unnecessary time
cost.

So an environment variable named AODH_AMBIGUOUS_ID will be checked,
only if its value is literally true, then we will allow
put name as positional argument, and if the name is UUID like,
no 404 raised for the first request, we will do an extra request
to check if the UUID liked name exist.

Change-Id: I936fbe66d2711db49c48d6a73638103fe8e5603e
'}]
commit_message:
treat alarm id as name if it is not uuid like

We can specify alarm name to do alarm {show, update, delete}, but
need to explicitly use --alarm-name, which seems not so convenient.

This patch adds a check for postional argument, if it is UUID like,
we treat it as alarm id, if not, we treat it as name.

However, there is a rare case that a name can be UUID like as well,
command will fail with 404 and people will treat it as a bug. We
can do an extra request for 404 error to try to use the value as
name, but it will sacrifice normal 404 case for unnecessary time
cost.

So an environment variable named AODH_AMBIGUOUS_ID will be checked,
only if its value is literally true, then we will allow
put name as positional argument, and if the name is UUID like,
no 404 raised for the first request, we will do an extra request
to check if the UUID liked name exist.

Change-Id: I936fbe66d2711db49c48d6a73638103fe8e5603e

commit_message:
Change graph date format on tooltip

This commit changes graph date formant on tooltip. We should show not
only date but also time because if we set the period to "a day", it's
hard to understand when it happened.

Change-Id: Iaf9fec29e9e09a2f1b4a16f9080693c25a1cb7ae
Closes-Bug: #1576790

cryptography 1.3.0 started using it's deprecated module utility for a
public API used by Glance. This utility did not tolerate patching very
well and when a patch context manager would exit, it would fail to
delete the patched attribute. This has been fixed since 1.3.0 was
released but the fix has not yet been released. Until then, let's avoid
1.3.0

(cherry picked from commit 6f01bcfd8438d03f4d87bc6d3bec5dce3304e9a8)
"}]
commit_message:
Blacklist cryptography 1.3.0

cryptography 1.3.0 started using it's deprecated module utility for a
public API used by Glance. This utility did not tolerate patching very
well and when a patch context manager would exit, it would fail to
delete the patched attribute. This has been fixed since 1.3.0 was
released but the fix has not yet been released. Until then, let's avoid
1.3.0

Change-Id: Ic442bc1cf03d103d85ad1e2acb42c10e882647be
Related-bug: 1560060
(cherry picked from commit 6f01bcfd8438d03f4d87bc6d3bec5dce3304e9a8)

subject: Test: fix some wrong use of Mock method
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-22 05:37:51.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backupagent.py'], 'message': "Test: fix some wrong use of Mock method

There is no method called_once_with() in Mock object.
And called_once_with() does nothing because it's a mock object.

1. In case `test_execute_backup`, there is no state `NEW` any more,
so remove this assertion.
Use assert_has_calls() intead of called_once_with().

2. In case `test_execute_bad_process_backup`, just need to verify that
BackupError will be raised when the runner check_process falsely.
So remove all the wrong assertions called_once_with().

3. In case `test_execute_lossy_backup`, add `BUILDING` state check, and
use assert_has_calls() instead of called_once_with().

4. In case `test_restore_unknown`, use assert_called_once_with() instead
of called_once_with().

Change-Id: Ic23e229de36b5787c66a54f971e81e82d0e718fc
Closes-Bug: #1544522
"}]
commit_message:
Test: fix some wrong use of Mock method

There is no method called_once_with() in Mock object.
And called_once_with() does nothing because it's a mock object.

1. In case `test_execute_backup`, there is no state `NEW` any more,
so remove this assertion.
Use assert_has_calls() intead of called_once_with().

2. In case `test_execute_bad_process_backup`, just need to verify that
BackupError will be raised when the runner check_process falsely.
So remove all the wrong assertions called_once_with().

3. In case `test_execute_lossy_backup`, add `BUILDING` state check, and
use assert_has_calls() instead of called_once_with().

4. In case `test_restore_unknown`, use assert_called_once_with() instead
of called_once_with().

Change-Id: Ic23e229de36b5787c66a54f971e81e82d0e718fc
Closes-Bug: #1544522

subject: Blacklist broken Babel releases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-21 03:17:03.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Blacklist broken Babel releases

Babel 2.3.2 failed to parse horizon.
Babel 2.3.3 fixes this but breaks all python projects, the log-level log
files contain far too much content ;(

From https://github.com/python-babel/babel/issues/388:
* versions 2.3.0..2.3.2 break multiple -k/--keywords arguments for
  pybabel extract
* version 2.3.3 breaks the single -k/--keywords argument accepted by
  distutils extract_messages

Blacklist all these versions, and downgrade constraints.

Change-Id: Ia61e96963c0c81814d89c247c82fd75c6ab86a81
(cherry picked from commit 5a9ac571092d515d0de9ee9eee88b1b7878f9cc0)
'}]
commit_message:
Blacklist broken Babel releases

Babel 2.3.2 failed to parse horizon.
Babel 2.3.3 fixes this but breaks all python projects, the log-level log
files contain far too much content ;(

From https://github.com/python-babel/babel/issues/388:
* versions 2.3.0..2.3.2 break multiple -k/--keywords arguments for
  pybabel extract
* version 2.3.3 breaks the single -k/--keywords argument accepted by
  distutils extract_messages

Blacklist all these versions, and downgrade constraints.

Change-Id: Ia61e96963c0c81814d89c247c82fd75c6ab86a81
(cherry picked from commit 5a9ac571092d515d0de9ee9eee88b1b7878f9cc0)

commit_message:

Babel 2.3.2 failed to parse horizon.
Babel 2.3.3 fixes this but breaks all python projects, the log-level log
files contain far too much content ;(

From https://github.com/python-babel/babel/issues/388:
* versions 2.3.0..2.3.2 break multiple -k/--keywords arguments for
  pybabel extract
* version 2.3.3 breaks the single -k/--keywords argument accepted by
  distutils extract_messages

Blacklist all these versions, and downgrade constraints.

Change-Id: Ia61e96963c0c81814d89c247c82fd75c6ab86a81
(cherry picked from commit 5a9ac571092d515d0de9ee9eee88b1b7878f9cc0)

Babel 2.3.2 failed to parse horizon.
Babel 2.3.3 fixes this but breaks all python projects, the log-level log

From https://github.com/python-babel/babel/issues/388:
* versions 2.3.0..2.3.2 break multiple -k/--keywords arguments for

* version 2.3.3 breaks the single -k/--keywords argument accepted by

commit_message:
change default ports for servers

Changing the recommended ports for Swift services
from ports 6000-6002 to unused ports 6200-6202;
so they do not conflict with X-Windows or other services.

Updated SAIO docs.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1521339
Change-Id: Ie1c778b159792c8e259e2a54cb86051686ac9d18

commit_message:

Restructure policy abstract driver

commit_message:
Pin the Django OpenStack Auth version

When using the v3 identity API, DOA 1.2.2 calls the keystone client
with a parameter that the keystone client doesn't support.

Pin the DOA version to 1.2.0 so that we avoid this incompatiblity
in Kilo installs.

Change-Id: Id0c2ed89f2edaddafac881340130b900adb87dc2
Closes-Bug: #1566455

subject: Define identity interface - easy cases
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 16465, 'name': 'Kristi Nikolla', 'email': 'knikolla@bu.edu', 'username': 'knikolla'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 19985, 'name': 'Ryosuke Mizuno', 'email': 'r-mizuno@rs.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'r-mizuno'}, {'_account_id': 20398, 'name': 'Roxana Gherle', 'username': 'gherle', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-04-19 13:42:45.000000000', 'files': ['tests-py3-blacklist.txt', 'keystone/tests/unit/identity/backends/test_base.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/identity/backends/test_ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/identity/backends/test_sql.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/base.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/identity/backends/__init__.py'], 'message': "Define identity interface - easy cases

The identity interface isn't adequately specified. Nobody could
implement an identity driver using the interface definition as it
is since they wouldn't know what the inputs are or the outputs.
We can't write a Manager using only the interface definition since
the definition is incomplete (For example it didn't even mention
that create_user returns the user).

Several tests are added specifically for the driver interface.
The driver was only tested through the manager, so we didn't have
tests that showed that the driver actually followed its interface,
just however the manager called it.

You might notice that the tests are missing some obvious cases
that should be tested. In some cases this is because the existing
drivers that we have (sql and ldap) don't work the same way. For
example, create_group on the sql driver always returns description
even when it's None while the ldap driver doesn't. I wanted to
keep this change simple and not modify the drivers. The interface
definition can be enhanced along with the drivers and these tests
can be added later.

There might be more requirements that the manager puts on the
drivers than what's documented/tested here. These can be added
later.

Change-Id: I9a9c660f2d98b6ac6cb032b40b32089cb5cf1844
"}]
commit_message:
Define identity interface - easy cases

The identity interface isn't adequately specified. Nobody could
implement an identity driver using the interface definition as it
is since they wouldn't know what the inputs are or the outputs.
We can't write a Manager using only the interface definition since
the definition is incomplete (For example it didn't even mention
that create_user returns the user).

Several tests are added specifically for the driver interface.
The driver was only tested through the manager, so we didn't have
tests that showed that the driver actually followed its interface,
just however the manager called it.

You might notice that the tests are missing some obvious cases
that should be tested. In some cases this is because the existing
drivers that we have (sql and ldap) don't work the same way. For
example, create_group on the sql driver always returns description
even when it's None while the ldap driver doesn't. I wanted to
keep this change simple and not modify the drivers. The interface
definition can be enhanced along with the drivers and these tests
can be added later.

There might be more requirements that the manager puts on the
drivers than what's documented/tested here. These can be added
later.

Change-Id: I9a9c660f2d98b6ac6cb032b40b32089cb5cf1844

commit_message:
Specify match_by in alarm-definition-update help message

Monasca cli - monasca help alarm-definition-update should
mention match_by instead of DIMENSION_KEY1,DIMENSION_KEY2 etc
This will help reduce confusion and will be more consistent
with monasca-api.

commit_message:
Fix Pecan singular collection controller lookups

Added get_pecan_controllers method to the auto_allocate_topology
extension so that the pecan controllers it uses are tailored
specifically for that extension.

Since the auto_allocated_topology is a singular collection, some extra
conditionals and handling were done to make the setting of plugins and
controllers correct.

Also, the patch that added support for legacy controllers was checking
to see if a collection already had a plugin set for it.  It really
needed to check if there was a controller already set for that
collection.

Change-Id: I2106cf01e1caefc817d6d27d5691452da730bb01
Closes-Bug: #1557519

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-26 16:22:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': "network: Fix nova boot with multiple security-groups

Booting an instance with 'default' + other security-groups doesn't
apply the 'default' security-group on the instance.
Nova is required to remove the 'default' security-group from the request
to Neutron when it's the only security-group that should be applied on
the instance.
This bug is a result of change
I630008a9733624a9d9b59b7aa3b8b2a3f8985d61.

Closes-Bug: #1572171
Change-Id: I3eb685f4d82615d3ebd25e7471de47129c78c86a
"}]
commit_message:
network: Fix nova boot with multiple security-groups

Booting an instance with 'default' + other security-groups doesn't
apply the 'default' security-group on the instance.
Nova is required to remove the 'default' security-group from the request
to Neutron when it's the only security-group that should be applied on
the instance.
This bug is a result of change
I630008a9733624a9d9b59b7aa3b8b2a3f8985d61.

Closes-Bug: #1572171
Change-Id: I3eb685f4d82615d3ebd25e7471de47129c78c86a

commit_message:
Fix race between event write and thread processing

Journal rows are written in the pre-commit hook,
thus available only when the original operation (i.e. add port) commits.
In order to prevent race condition the journal triggering  was moved
from pre-commit to post-commit.

Change-Id: I0b52ccb43b405e7dd3d4f65066169a8bbee58c39
Closes-Bug: #1569986

commit_message:
ODL v2: Fix delay in sync pending rows

Fixed the delay in sync pending rows, so when "call_thread_on_end"
is called or thread timer is expired the thread will start the sync logic
with no delay.

Instead of starting the sync thread when it stops the thread will start
only once on the class initialization and will wait for event to be set.

Change-Id: I214c9372726e5e8cf333d8736c23332870377cbf
Closes-Bug: #1569923

commit_message:
Add new doc structure and contents for swiftclient

As a result of the Hackathon we have produced a new
documentation structure for the python-swiftclient.
This patch introduces the new structure and adds the
required content.

The intention is to document the CLI, the SwiftService
and Connection API. Importantly, we also provide
guidance on important considerations when using a swift
object store, such as which aspect of the python-swiftclient
to use for various use cases, common authentication patterns
and some useful examples.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandra Settle <alexandra.settle@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mohit Motiani <mohit.motiani@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hisashi Osanai <osanai.hisashi@jp.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I9eb41f8e9137efa66cead67dc264a76a3c03fbda

commit_message:
vpnaas: install apparmor before restarting the service

This plugin is not used in neutron-vpnaas gate since Liberty where we
use a devstack plugin. Sadly, the code is still used in Kilo gate of the
project.

This change will need to be backported up to kilo.

The change reflects the corresponding patch in neutron-vpnaas devstack
plugin: Ic569c43e014ef11f8121db7dd5047a39579a4633

Change-Id: I6a2a127c3e17515172fbbd3bf1a1d1d1721e6cf6

commit_message:
Do not allow new creates for HIDDEN resources

Since HIDDEN is the last step in the resource deprecation process, we
should not allow creation of new stacks which contain HIDDEN resources.

blueprint: hidden-supportstatus-improvements
Change-Id: I6456667d97241045adaefdabacc270c2ac2256dc

commit_message:
Provide driver in ODL for L2Gateway.

For more details on L2Gateway feature
present in OpenDaylight(ODL), please look here:
https://wiki.opendaylight.org/view/OVSDB:Hardware_VTEP

The L2Gateway API for Neutron spec is here:
https://github.com/openstack/networking-l2gw/blob/
  master/specs/kilo/l2-gateway-api.rst

This review depends on L2GW Service Driver
framework fix available here:
https://review.openstack.org/265692

Depends-On: Ib56ee8bfd182c031e468c503acb0cd75daea8c40
Change-Id: Ie42795e8af3a90684852ac3b55e2f62a5fde3978
Closes-Bug: #1552540

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-02 21:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/065_add_connector_fields_to_volume_attachment.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Add connector info to volume_attachment table

******************** WIP ***************************

Lots of work to get the unit tests sorted out still

Further cleanup/refinement in the the attach/detach methods
wouldn't hurt.

Revisit multi-attach plans, this patch should make it
a bit cleaner and easier to deal with going forward.

******************** WIP ***************************

A challenge we have with multi-attach and force-detach type operations is
having all of the needed connector info available to make the detach.

It turns out we have a mechanism for storing/keeping all of this, in fact
we have a few in use (volume_attachment table, volume table info, metadata...).

TLDR:
Store the connector info that is passed in during intiialize_connection
into a n attachment entry of the volume_attachment table.  We can then also
return the attachment_id to the caller so they can track and reference it as
needed (ie, future API calls send in the attachment ID to the detach method).

This patch just cleans up the initialize_connection and attach_volume methods.
Calls like begin_attach and attach should for the most part just be db updates
and callback methods.  The real *work* should be done in initialize_connection.
NOTE this change is just a foundation to clean up some the code we have and
doesn't change the behavior of any of the API's or how they're called.  Instead
we just fill in a complete volume_attachment entry instead of only parts of it
and we set a precedent that that table is a trusted resource.

Change-Id: I05f6afd3ad79d4164505543ac9bacdc7be802c2b
"}]
commit_message:
Add connector info to volume_attachment table

******************** WIP ***************************

Lots of work to get the unit tests sorted out still

Further cleanup/refinement in the the attach/detach methods
wouldn't hurt.

Revisit multi-attach plans, this patch should make it
a bit cleaner and easier to deal with going forward.

******************** WIP ***************************

A challenge we have with multi-attach and force-detach type operations is
having all of the needed connector info available to make the detach.

It turns out we have a mechanism for storing/keeping all of this, in fact
we have a few in use (volume_attachment table, volume table info, metadata...).

TLDR:
Store the connector info that is passed in during intiialize_connection
into a n attachment entry of the volume_attachment table.  We can then also
return the attachment_id to the caller so they can track and reference it as
needed (ie, future API calls send in the attachment ID to the detach method).

This patch just cleans up the initialize_connection and attach_volume methods.
Calls like begin_attach and attach should for the most part just be db updates
and callback methods.  The real *work* should be done in initialize_connection.
NOTE this change is just a foundation to clean up some the code we have and
doesn't change the behavior of any of the API's or how they're called.  Instead
we just fill in a complete volume_attachment entry instead of only parts of it
and we set a precedent that that table is a trusted resource.

Change-Id: I05f6afd3ad79d4164505543ac9bacdc7be802c2b

commit_message:
libvirt: remove version checks for PCI device detach

The PCI device detach code relies on the libvirt device
remove event added in libvirt 1.1.1 which is older than
our min required libvirt. Thus we can remove the version
checks for this feature.

Change-Id: I3fffeb65eb74535e1266feb8b03fea91a130bfc6

Update of overcloud nodes should follow right after undercloud update.
The reason is that new templates may expect features included in
newer packages installed on overcloud nodes (for example new puppet
class definitions). Also adds note about having to explicitly use
default environment registry file - otherwise some resource definitions
may be missing.

Change-Id: I34d8826edc9efe248ab82e36cb1d40914fa9dca4
'}]
commit_message:
Change undercloud update instructions

Update of overcloud nodes should follow right after undercloud update.
The reason is that new templates may expect features included in
newer packages installed on overcloud nodes (for example new puppet
class definitions). Also adds note about having to explicitly use
default environment registry file - otherwise some resource definitions
may be missing.

Change-Id: I34d8826edc9efe248ab82e36cb1d40914fa9dca4

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-29 16:15:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py'], 'message': "Wrong mocks, wrong mock order

This test was mocking the wrong driver (virt.driver.ComputeDriver vs.
virt.fake.SmallFakeDriver), so the test wasn't actually ever hitting
that mock; just mock self.compute.driver instead so we don't have to
care which one it is.

This test also had the mock args in the wrong order (decorators are
applied from the bottom upwards), but that doesn't matter now that there
is only one decorator at the method definition level (the other is now a
context manager mock).

The DB mock was wrong too (nova.db.api vs nova.db). It should have been
called when you commented out the following logic that is was testing,
but it isn't. That mock should probably be at the object level anyway,
changing it to mock objects.InstanceList.get_by_filters instead.

            if len(driver_uuids) == 0:
                # Short circuit, don't waste a DB call
                return objects.InstanceList()

Change-Id: I02db1afbeb9c60c4c601e92e41cad053f52cb1b7
"}]
commit_message:
Wrong mocks, wrong mock order

This test was mocking the wrong driver (virt.driver.ComputeDriver vs.
virt.fake.SmallFakeDriver), so the test wasn't actually ever hitting
that mock; just mock self.compute.driver instead so we don't have to
care which one it is.

This test also had the mock args in the wrong order (decorators are
applied from the bottom upwards), but that doesn't matter now that there
is only one decorator at the method definition level (the other is now a
context manager mock).

The DB mock was wrong too (nova.db.api vs nova.db). It should have been
called when you commented out the following logic that is was testing,
but it isn't. That mock should probably be at the object level anyway,
changing it to mock objects.InstanceList.get_by_filters instead.

            if len(driver_uuids) == 0:
                # Short circuit, don't waste a DB call
                return objects.InstanceList()

Change-Id: I02db1afbeb9c60c4c601e92e41cad053f52cb1b7

commit_message:
Add ALIAS records to designate objects

This adds the initial ALIAS object recordsets.

Note: The RECORD_TYPE value is set to `260` to be in line with
      PowerDNS, the single DNS server that we know that supports
      ALIAS records natively.

Change-Id: I7451931bdb9cc80bccca8c12ec2e9510c35a1287

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-03-29 04:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/recordset.py', 'designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/tables.py', 'designate/mdns/handler.py', 'designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/087_add_visible_and_alias_to_recordsets.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/recordsets.py', 'designate/tests/test_zone_manager/test_tasks.py'], 'message': "Update database and add ALIAS record support

This includes the visibility aspects of ALIAS support. No actual ALIAS
records can be submitted just yet. There is also a comment in the
recordset API to use only `api` visible records.

Also, SQLAlchemy converts enums to varchar and doesn't seem to pass
along all args (ie `default`) to the varchar. Therefore I had to make
the visible column nullable.

Depends-On: I26dff77c22f964ada0100c36e92e848b4667ab0e
Change-Id: I02ed90d3e7f64bbd5e9acc8133dce0b7e0e560e2
"}]
commit_message:
Update database and add ALIAS record support

This includes the visibility aspects of ALIAS support. No actual ALIAS
records can be submitted just yet. There is also a comment in the
recordset API to use only `api` visible records.

Also, SQLAlchemy converts enums to varchar and doesn't seem to pass
along all args (ie `default`) to the varchar. Therefore I had to make
the visible column nullable.

Depends-On: I26dff77c22f964ada0100c36e92e848b4667ab0e
Change-Id: I02ed90d3e7f64bbd5e9acc8133dce0b7e0e560e2

commit_message:
Move OpenStack client to test-requirements

OpenStack client is not a runtime dependency of heatclient,
and having it in requirements just brings in many unneeded dependencies.

Move it to test-requirements so unit tests for osc plugin work.

Change-Id: I425b33d5e97e9328fe440f6b190bdd6b6cc813bf
Closes-Bug: #1562023

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-19 15:13:20.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/json-schema-for-notifications.rst'], 'message': 'JSON schema for notifications

Versioned notifications has a well defined schema implemented with
versioned objects. This schema prevents nova from changing the
structure of the notification without communicating the change to
the notification consumers. This communication is done via the version
number embedded into the notification payload. However this communication
is limited and does not contain information about what is changed in the
schema or what is the the structure of a new notification.

Change-Id: I185708f9d81f809c02f5a32f6896bc20946a0002
Implements: bp json-schema-for-notifications
'}]
commit_message:
JSON schema for notifications

Versioned notifications has a well defined schema implemented with
versioned objects. This schema prevents nova from changing the
structure of the notification without communicating the change to
the notification consumers. This communication is done via the version
number embedded into the notification payload. However this communication
is limited and does not contain information about what is changed in the
schema or what is the the structure of a new notification.

Change-Id: I185708f9d81f809c02f5a32f6896bc20946a0002
Implements: bp json-schema-for-notifications

Angular based Horizon widgets and Horizon plugins will want to

Change-Id: I612c6bfefa8e157f7219938bb3e82896dde8fa09

commit_message:
Angular direct service access.

Angular based Horizon widgets and Horizon plugins will want to
contact OpenStack API's directly to enable much more responsive UI
and to place less load on the Horizon servers by proxying service
calls through horizon proxies.

Change-Id: I612c6bfefa8e157f7219938bb3e82896dde8fa09

subject: Add dependencies for paramiko 2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-29 11:28:19.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Add dependencies for paramiko 2.0

Paramiko version 2.0 has been released. It now uses the Python library
cryptography. Installing this requires additional system packages. This
commit adds in the appropriate packages required by cryptography based
on its documentation [1].

An alternative approach would have been to constrain the version of
Paramiko however the project describes the 1.x versions as relying on
insecure dependencies [2].

The apt packages autoconf and g++ are removed because they are
dependencies of build-essential.

[1] https://cryptography.io/en/latest/installation/
[2] http://www.paramiko.org/installing.html

Change-Id: Ia7e0d64214cfd5412ec236ee4bdd6a076821d258
'}]
commit_message:
Add dependencies for paramiko 2.0

Paramiko version 2.0 has been released. It now uses the Python library
cryptography. Installing this requires additional system packages. This
commit adds in the appropriate packages required by cryptography based
on its documentation [1].

An alternative approach would have been to constrain the version of
Paramiko however the project describes the 1.x versions as relying on
insecure dependencies [2].

The apt packages autoconf and g++ are removed because they are
dependencies of build-essential.

[1] https://cryptography.io/en/latest/installation/
[2] http://www.paramiko.org/installing.html

Change-Id: Ia7e0d64214cfd5412ec236ee4bdd6a076821d258

commit_message:
Pylint: refactor ignored message lists

The way these are organized makes it rather hard to
associate comments and their messages, and makes it
more work to modify this list in a meaningful way (or
re-use it for a project like os-brick).

Move things around a bit to make this easier to manage.

Change-Id: Ieebca9f97f6b15832693a37fa03f97c1074d64e8

subject: Fix ControllerExtraConfig parameter name
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-18 09:11:54.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'overcloud.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix ControllerExtraConfig parameter name

We've had a typo for a while that a parameter is named
"controllerExtraConfig" with lowercase c, which can be quite confusing
for users because the other similar parameters
(e.g. NovaComputeExtraConfig) consistently start with an upper case
letter.

We'll support both variants from now on, marking the typoed variant as
deprecated.

Change-Id: Ic67a4297e7fa08308889b95ba35389a01f70f5a4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ControllerExtraConfig parameter name

We've had a typo for a while that a parameter is named
"controllerExtraConfig" with lowercase c, which can be quite confusing
for users because the other similar parameters
(e.g. NovaComputeExtraConfig) consistently start with an upper case
letter.

We'll support both variants from now on, marking the typoed variant as
deprecated.

Change-Id: Ic67a4297e7fa08308889b95ba35389a01f70f5a4

commit_message:
Add a No Prior Key Certificate Order Type

Current Barbican TLS certificate order types require clients to provide
a CSR or a previously-stored public key. However, some use cases (such
as automated device provisioning) require Barbican to generate the
private/public/CSR information and then to create the certificate. This
blueprint proposes adding this 'generate-key' order type.

Change-Id: I9a2c4d7a7166f6bf8cc2d8eb0fb235ea23d9d68f
Implements: blueprint api-order-certificate-add-no-prior-key-type
APIImpact: Adds a new certificate order metadata type to /v1/orders
DocImpact: Update orders resource docs to mention the new type

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-10 14:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/api-order-ssl-add-reissue-support.rst'], 'message': "Add to Orders API Support to Reissue Certificates

This blueprint adds to Barbican the ability to reissue a X.509
certificate. After a certificate is issued via a Barbican 'certificate'
order (which produces a certificate in Barbican with a unique UUID), it
should then be possible to create another Barbican order to reissue a
certificate by providing the UUID of the original certificate. The
original order information could then be used for the new order,
including the original certificate information and ordering information
specific to the certificate authority (CA) that issued the certificate
originally.

Change-Id: I0968b8c010f348a783413b9bc3c71b7794571dfb
Implements: blueprint api-order-ssl-add-reissue-support
APIImpact: Adds a new certificate order type to /v1/orders
DocImpact: Update orders resource and plugin docs to mention the new type
"}]
commit_message:
Add to Orders API Support to Reissue Certificates

This blueprint adds to Barbican the ability to reissue a X.509
certificate. After a certificate is issued via a Barbican 'certificate'
order (which produces a certificate in Barbican with a unique UUID), it
should then be possible to create another Barbican order to reissue a
certificate by providing the UUID of the original certificate. The
original order information could then be used for the new order,
including the original certificate information and ordering information
specific to the certificate authority (CA) that issued the certificate
originally.

Change-Id: I0968b8c010f348a783413b9bc3c71b7794571dfb
Implements: blueprint api-order-ssl-add-reissue-support
APIImpact: Adds a new certificate order type to /v1/orders
DocImpact: Update orders resource and plugin docs to mention the new type

commit_message:
Security Utilities for fuzz tests

This file contains helper methods used for security fuzz tests. It
generates datasets that can be used in parameterized test cases, and
verifies responses to API requests to ensure that they do not contain
indicators of vulnerability.

subject: Special Handling for Functional Tests that don't support concurrency
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7764, 'name': 'Peter Hamilton', 'email': 'peter.hamilton@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'Peter'}, {'_account_id': 8623, 'name': 'Kaitlin Farr', 'email': 'kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'kaitlin.farr'}, {'_account_id': 9234, 'name': 'Steve Heyman', 'email': 'steve@heyman.com', 'username': 'hockeynut'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-26 18:13:52.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_quotas.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Special Handling for Functional Tests that don't support concurrency

The project quotas paging test cases do not support concurrency.
Since they all use the same database, checks that verify a specific
number of things are in that database might fail if other tests
are concurrently adding/deleting things from that database.

This commit marks those tests with the "no_concurrency" attribute, and
then instructs tox to run those tests separately when running functional
tests.  Marked tests will be run first without the --processes=-1 flag.
Unmarked tests will be run next with the --processes=-1, to enable
parallel test runs.

Change-Id: I56740a4993b5b9c7976b3c52a701605cd5815a5b
'}]
commit_message:
Special Handling for Functional Tests that don't support concurrency

The project quotas paging test cases do not support concurrency.
Since they all use the same database, checks that verify a specific
number of things are in that database might fail if other tests
are concurrently adding/deleting things from that database.

This commit marks those tests with the "no_concurrency" attribute, and
then instructs tox to run those tests separately when running functional
tests.  Marked tests will be run first without the --processes=-1 flag.
Unmarked tests will be run next with the --processes=-1, to enable
parallel test runs.

Change-Id: I56740a4993b5b9c7976b3c52a701605cd5815a5b

subject: Wrote fuzz tests for ACLs
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-04 18:06:07.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_acls.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/behaviors/acl_behaviors.py'], 'message': 'Wrote fuzz tests for ACLs

These tests will attempt CRUD operations on ACLs, replacing parameters in the
request with common attack strings used in penetration testing. We check the
requests for server side error messages and for the presence of attack strings
in the response.

Currently, most API methods will be tested for the following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

Change-Id: I00321d5c58d097e96ad1884da29768b66e898132
Related-Bug: #1481021
'}]
commit_message:
Wrote fuzz tests for ACLs

These tests will attempt CRUD operations on ACLs, replacing parameters in the
request with common attack strings used in penetration testing. We check the
requests for server side error messages and for the presence of attack strings
in the response.

Currently, most API methods will be tested for the following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

Change-Id: I00321d5c58d097e96ad1884da29768b66e898132
Related-Bug: #1481021

commit_message:
Introduce the concept of an Active SecretStore

Introduce the concept of Active and Inactive SecretStore plugins. Active
SecretStore will be limited to one and only one, but you may have zero
or more inactive SecretStores.

Change-Id: I8a9601214c8b1c422dc7333a38868efd26789b13

commit_message:
Barbican objects base

This patch is to insert the objects code base, It based on
oslo_versionedobjects.  This is done to make progress on
changing barbican internals to use VersionObjects.

Inserted objects code base into barbican and modified barbican
services to use object-aware serializer.

Change-Id: Ieca60e2303f3ff679f2a035b0e0a373e64404d49
Implements: blueprint barbican-objects
Author: Daniel Tadrzak <daniel.tadrzak@intel.com>

commit_message:
Register all objects

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-20 15:35:23.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/save-order-info-on-created-secrets.rst'], 'message': "Save order information on created secrets/containers

Currently there is no information stored on created secrets/containers
as to the order that was used to create them. It would be useful for
information such as the order's metadata to be available to clients
when created secrets or containers are retrieved. Also, there are some
SSL-related workflows involving existing certificate containers that
require information from the original order and order-plugin metadata.
For example, certificate reissue or revocation workflows require

DocImpact: Update orders resource doc to include 'order_ref'
SecurityImpact: Orders entities could be long-lived now

Change-Id: I6022ef7d5a9cec34abed05cceb95e226b1133e56
"}]
commit_message:
Save order information on created secrets/containers

Currently there is no information stored on created secrets/containers
as to the order that was used to create them. It would be useful for
information such as the order's metadata to be available to clients
when created secrets or containers are retrieved. Also, there are some
SSL-related workflows involving existing certificate containers that
require information from the original order and order-plugin metadata.
For example, certificate reissue or revocation workflows require
information found only in the original order and plugin metadata such
as the original certificate authority (CA) order ID used to generate
the certificate (stored in order plugin metadata), or original contact
information (stored in order metadata). This blueprint proposes means
to store the information for later access.

APIImpact: Adds an 'order_ref' element to the orders resource response
DocImpact: Update orders resource doc to include 'order_ref'
SecurityImpact: Orders entities could be long-lived now
Implements: blueprint save-order-info-on-created-secrets
Change-Id: I6022ef7d5a9cec34abed05cceb95e226b1133e56

subject: Add to Orders API Support to Renew X.509 Certificates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-27 19:52:02.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/api-order-cert-add-renewal-support.rst'], 'message': "Add to Orders API Support to Renew X.509 Certificates

This blueprint adds to Barbican the ability to renew an X.509
certificate. The workflow of this blueprint is very similar to that
detailed in the reissue blueprint [1]. After a certificate is issued
via a Barbican 'certificate' order (which produces a container in
Barbican with a unique UUID), it should then be possible to create
another Barbican order to renew a certificate by providing the UUID of
the original certificate container. The original order information
could then be used for the new order, including the original
certificate information and ordering information specific to the
certificate authority (CA) that issued the certificate originally.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/api-order-ssl-add-reissue-support

Change-Id: Iab43015745970862bb2cb88972bda580af3ab916
Implements: blueprint api-order-cert-add-renewal-support
APIImpact: Adds a new certificate order type to /v1/orders
DocImpact: Update orders resource and plugin docs to mention the new type
"}]
commit_message:
Add to Orders API Support to Renew X.509 Certificates

This blueprint adds to Barbican the ability to renew an X.509
certificate. The workflow of this blueprint is very similar to that
detailed in the reissue blueprint [1]. After a certificate is issued
via a Barbican 'certificate' order (which produces a container in
Barbican with a unique UUID), it should then be possible to create
another Barbican order to renew a certificate by providing the UUID of
the original certificate container. The original order information
could then be used for the new order, including the original
certificate information and ordering information specific to the
certificate authority (CA) that issued the certificate originally.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/api-order-ssl-add-reissue-support

Change-Id: Iab43015745970862bb2cb88972bda580af3ab916
Implements: blueprint api-order-cert-add-renewal-support
APIImpact: Adds a new certificate order type to /v1/orders
DocImpact: Update orders resource and plugin docs to mention the new type

commit_message:
Add Revoke Certificate Order Type

This blueprint adds to Barbican the ability to revoke X.509
certificates that have been generated by Barbican. After an certificate
is issued via a Barbican 'certificate' order (which produces a
certificate container entity in Barbican with a unique UUID), it should
then be possible to create another Barbican order to revoke this
certificate by providing the UUID of the original certificate
container. The original order information could then be used for the
new order, including the original certificate information and ordering
information specific to the certificate authority (CA) that issued the
certificate originally.

Change-Id: Id9936750d513864097314f3510c11b4c6a57ec01
Implements: blueprint api-orders-add-revoke-certificate-type
APIImpact: Adds a new certificate order type to /v1/orders
DocImpact: Update orders resource and plugin docs to mention the new type

Add Cancel Certificate Order Type

This blueprint adds to Barbican the ability to cancel X.509
certificates that have been generated by Barbican. After an certificate
is issued via a Barbican 'certificate' order (which produces a
certificate container entity in Barbican with a unique UUID), it should
then be possible to create another Barbican order to cancel this
certificate by providing the UUID of the original certificate
container. The original order information could then be used for the
new order, including the original certificate information and ordering
information specific to the certificate authority (CA) that issued the
certificate originally.

Change-Id: I39f49225a0325bc74cb1e3172d2fa225d3e61399
Implements: blueprint api-orders-add-cancel-certificate-type

1. config options for the client to do transport wrapping
2. Logic to retrieve and cache transport keys
3. Logic to use transport key wrapping when storing secrets

commit_message:
Implement transport key wrapping for barbican-client

This patch adds:
1. config options for the client to do transport wrapping
2. Logic to retrieve and cache transport keys
3. Logic to use transport key wrapping when storing secrets
4. Logic to use transport key wrapping when retrieving secrets

The implementation of the crypto bits will be in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ice551459d9c7704f12ba1592313971bab36cb151
Implements: blueprint add-wrapping-key-to-barbican-server

commit_message:
Increase scope of stopable states

Our CI testing has done some hair pin turns on the VMs from create to
destroy.  This uncovered an issue where VMs would be in the 'Shutting
Down' state.  The nova-powervm power off operation would not wait for
the shutting down command to finish.

This change set fixes that issue.

Change-Id: I8a84cf6a9c495ec710aa21ee297b15a08d6f8a21
Closes-Bug: bug/1573042
(cherry picked from commit bb25f7a552058ec3484e63fa10606c526dd3ebff)
Conflicts:
        nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vm.py

commit_message:
Deployment reports datetime DB insertion was fixed

When MySQL is used as a database backend deployment
notification reports could not be persisted due to the
fact that MySQL could not store timezone offset of
datetime.datetime.

Change-Id: Iea3b7d8d37ac68f0ebdcdcf96471a0d18a29469f
Closes-Bug: #1570933
(cherry picked from commit a787d631ec0b0132c9504eca0a71aaef3cb445da)

commit_message:
Don't use self.env.clusters[0] in tests where possible

Since self.env.create always return db object now,
we can use this returned value instead of
self.env.clusters list.

It's a refactoring, so no bug or blueprint.

Change-Id: If7c84cb7124bcf08ef5ff110542012564190fae1

commit_message:
Add python-openstackclient to test-requirements

According to OSC docs, python-openstackclient must be added to
test-requirements.txt if the plugin can also be used as a library,
or requirements.txt if the plugin requires the OSC to be installed.

The OSC version used is taken from global-requirements.

Change-Id: I071819313d80724fbbca0cfdb12dac8180ba2d95
Closes-Bug: #1575259

commit_message:
Introduce priorities for network_schemes

Currently we have no way to control templates applying order
for set of roles(cinder+compute). This patch introduces ability
to specify absolute priority for template to make it possible for
operator to manage templates order. Patch doesn't affect order of
templates where 'priority' field is not specified.

Change-Id: I4348d3dea2c382837eb7f96e5b0ae3eb0312c8ad
Closes-bug: 1540374
(cherry picked from commit 35726f4e9bba16327229355c6f5d90ead5867854)

subject: Activate libnetwork plugin with .spec instead of .json
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-22 01:16:07.000000000', 'files': ['etc/kuryr.spec', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Activate libnetwork plugin with .spec instead of .json

Docker 1.11.0 fails to activate libnetwork plugins specified with .json files.
Using .spec files still works. Adding a .spec file and configuring devstack to
work around the bug.

Change-Id: I041a5e9a526c2e63c92f3d01411afda8b7beb601
Closes-Bug: #1572369
Signed-off-by: Frederick F. Kautz IV <fkautz@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Activate libnetwork plugin with .spec instead of .json

Docker 1.11.0 fails to activate libnetwork plugins specified with .json files.
Using .spec files still works. Adding a .spec file and configuring devstack to
work around the bug.

Change-Id: I041a5e9a526c2e63c92f3d01411afda8b7beb601
Closes-Bug: #1572369
Signed-off-by: Frederick F. Kautz IV <fkautz@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints

Instead of using values hardcoded in os-cloud-config. This commit
uses the values that come from the endpoint map that's used
in the t-h-t. This in turns, allows us to be able to change the
port and even the host used for the public and internal endpoints;
this is still not the case for the admin endpoints, as it is based
on the internal endpoint of the service. The aforementioned
limitation comes from os-cloud-config.

conflicts:
    tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py
    tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/fakes.py
    tripleoclient/utils.py
    tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py
    tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Change-Id: I0cf9ada1110f6b1452480039c136aee1fc3ccc82
Closes-Bug: #1569851
(cherry picked from commit d67ccaf7baf7beb7ea3559c84ae0c645d0452dd8)

commit_message:
Make 'cover' job use always venv

Without this change 'cover'job starts dialog for running
either in host env or venv and fails not getting proper choice.

Therefore, make it use venv always.

Change-Id: I411ac40a1fde61cbeb725cf5dba850ab6a82e95c

subject: Add a bandit environment to tox
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendiz√°bal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11397, 'name': 'Doug Chivers', 'email': 'dougchivers@gmail.com', 'username': 'dg'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}, {'_account_id': 16046, 'name': 'Fernando Diaz', 'email': 'diazjf@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'diazjf'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-28 22:06:23.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add a bandit environment to tox

This change is being proposed as part of the OpenStack Security Project
working session at the Austin 2016 summit. It adds support for running
the bandit[1] security linting tool against the Castellan codebase.
This change adds a targetted environment for bandit and also adds
bandit as part of the pep8 job.

The bandit configuration has been tailored to exclude tests that are
currently producing warning against the codebase. These issues will be
followed up with bug reports and patches.

At the time of submission, Castellan passes all Bandit tests configured
in tox.

[1]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Security/Projects/Bandit

Change-Id: I19368d3440ad5dc862e7d91f7890f9b1901fced3
'}]
commit_message:
Add a bandit environment to tox

This change is being proposed as part of the OpenStack Security Project
working session at the Austin 2016 summit. It adds support for running
the bandit[1] security linting tool against the Castellan codebase.
This change adds a targetted environment for bandit and also adds
bandit as part of the pep8 job.

The bandit configuration has been tailored to exclude tests that are
currently producing warning against the codebase. These issues will be
followed up with bug reports and patches.

At the time of submission, Castellan passes all Bandit tests configured
in tox.

[1]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Security/Projects/Bandit

Change-Id: I19368d3440ad5dc862e7d91f7890f9b1901fced3

subject: Fix xtrabackup SST failures
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-29 13:19:22.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/database/database_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/database/database.pp'], 'message': 'Fix xtrabackup SST failures

Xtrabackup-v2 requires the [mysqld] innodb-log-group-home-dir and
innodb-data-file-path in order to not race/mess with paths
when invoking innobackupex --move-back to finish the SST.

Set the innodb-data-file-path with mysql default.
Set the innodb-log-group-home-dir to a custom ./logs dir, otherwise
innobackupex still complains about "Destination file exists" issue.
Also make xtrabackup to not remove the ./logs dir via [sst] cpat
conf setting.

Closes-bug: #1576073

Change-Id: I3096e57f8684be6ff949a8a30c30785aa665806f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix xtrabackup SST failures

Xtrabackup-v2 requires the [mysqld] innodb-log-group-home-dir and
innodb-data-file-path in order to not race/mess with paths
when invoking innobackupex --move-back to finish the SST.

Set the innodb-data-file-path with mysql default.
Set the innodb-log-group-home-dir to a custom ./logs dir, otherwise
innobackupex still complains about "Destination file exists" issue.
Also make xtrabackup to not remove the ./logs dir via [sst] cpat
conf setting.

Closes-bug: #1576073

Change-Id: I3096e57f8684be6ff949a8a30c30785aa665806f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

This makes it easier to run multiple task files in one run. Multiple
task files are merged intelligently, and all scenarios in all files
are run. Each file is rendered as a standalone template, rather than
combining all of the files and rendering it once; this is necessary
because multiple YAML files cannot necessarily be concatenated and

afterwards.

Change-Id: Ie42848bd817d78d5f2fa38d3d581ed2560f6851b
'}]
commit_message:
Make --task accept multiple files

This makes it easier to run multiple task files in one run. Multiple
task files are merged intelligently, and all scenarios in all files
are run. Each file is rendered as a standalone template, rather than
combining all of the files and rendering it once; this is necessary
because multiple YAML files cannot necessarily be concatenated and
remain parseable, so we have to parse the YAML per-file and combine
afterwards.

Change-Id: Ie42848bd817d78d5f2fa38d3d581ed2560f6851b

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-28 19:56:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/powervm/__init__.py', 'nova/__init__.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/fixtures.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg', 'devstack/settings', 'nova/virt/powervm/driver.py'], 'message': 'Shim compute driver in nova.virt namespace

Recent nova commit 8eb03de1eb83a6cd2d4d41804e1b8253f94e5400 removed the
mechanism by which nova-powervm was loading its ComputeDriver from out

With Change-Id: I78c0ca85cb6ee2e370214a89a203f6f099748930 we can now add
to the nova.virt namespace from the nova-powervm package.

This change set restores the ability to load the driver by creating a

Partial-Bug: 1575335
'}]
commit_message:
Shim compute driver in nova.virt namespace

Recent nova commit 8eb03de1eb83a6cd2d4d41804e1b8253f94e5400 removed the
mechanism by which nova-powervm was loading its ComputeDriver from out
of tree.

With Change-Id: I78c0ca85cb6ee2e370214a89a203f6f099748930 we can now add
to the nova.virt namespace from the nova-powervm package.

This change set restores the ability to load the driver by creating a
thin shim into nova.virt.powervm.driver, passing through all public
symbols from nova_powervm.virt.powervm.driver.

Change-Id: I8ff5154edfcef6fa83686b2ae046512ce7d6d628
Partial-Bug: 1575335

commit_message:
Extract ISO label directly from file

In order to avoid hardcoded value of ISO_LABEL now we extract them
directly from file using tool `file`.

Change-Id: I876618ac16a265224f51dde403a1a7eef6939a48

commit_message:
Extract ISO label directly from file

In order to avoid hardcoded value of ISO_LABEL now we extract them
directly from file using tool `file`.

Change-Id: I876618ac16a265224f51dde403a1a7eef6939a48
Closes-Bug: #1575804

subject: [WIP] [PoC] Consume multipart data from Horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-21 13:52:36.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/utils.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py'], 'message': '[WIP] [PoC] Consume multipart data from Horizon

In order to prevent Horizon from storing image on Controller
Glance can consume multipart requests. In that case Glance
need to unpack multipart form on the fly in assumption
that only one big part is needed.

Change-Id: I6540a7241860ae1ebc68de34ad29cf696f57e7cc
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] [PoC] Consume multipart data from Horizon

In order to prevent Horizon from storing image on Controller
Glance can consume multipart requests. In that case Glance
need to unpack multipart form on the fly in assumption
that only one big part is needed.

Change-Id: I6540a7241860ae1ebc68de34ad29cf696f57e7cc

commit_message:
Update cinder-vmware conf for cinder multi backend

* Update cinder-vmware conf for cinder multi backend
* Fix the spec framework for this module so the
  spec can be actually used
* Disable non-working specs in the vmware modules
  somebody should fix them later.
* Add spec for vmware::cinder::vmdk
  It tests only this templates and
  should be finished later too.
* Enable spec for this module in the Fuel CI

Change-Id: Id3b8cdb10acd0d7a63a085c03795169c5f304c13
Closes-Bug: #1569874
Closes-Bug: #1496009
(cherry picked from commit 8febf5a5c7572391045fb7a00b4f51a8d6fa830f)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-29 10:14:40.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_plugin/testing/tests/unit/test_support_utilities.py', 'fuel_health/config.py', 'fuel_health/nmanager.py', 'fuel_plugin/ostf_adapter/mixins.py', 'fuel_health/tests/smoke/test_dpdk.py', 'fuel_plugin/testing/tests/base.py'], 'message': 'Check connectivity from instance with DPDK via floating IP

Scenario:
1. Create a new security group (if it doesn`t exist yet).
2. Create router
3. Create network
4. Create subnet
5. Uplink subnet to router.
6. Create new flavor with huge pages
7. Create an instance using the new flavor, security group
in created subnet. Boot it on compute with enabled DPDK.
8. Create a new floating IP
9. Assign the new floating IP to the instance.
10. Check connectivity to the floating IP using ping command.
11. Check that public IP 8.8.8.8 can be pinged from instance.
12. Disassociate server floating ip.
13. Delete floating ip
14. Delete server.
15. Delete flavor
16. Remove router.
17. Remove subnet
18. Remove network

Change-Id: I86c43896a6b7ff0e55f72dd7ffce02487ac7299e
Closes-Bug: #1567439
(cherry picked from commit 1eb65cc189ccc2125c9845d025aec937d2a56ab4)
'}]
commit_message:
Check connectivity from instance with DPDK via floating IP

Scenario:
1. Create a new security group (if it doesn`t exist yet).
2. Create router
3. Create network
4. Create subnet
5. Uplink subnet to router.
6. Create new flavor with huge pages
7. Create an instance using the new flavor, security group
in created subnet. Boot it on compute with enabled DPDK.
8. Create a new floating IP
9. Assign the new floating IP to the instance.
10. Check connectivity to the floating IP using ping command.
11. Check that public IP 8.8.8.8 can be pinged from instance.
12. Disassociate server floating ip.
13. Delete floating ip
14. Delete server.
15. Delete flavor
16. Remove router.
17. Remove subnet
18. Remove network

Change-Id: I86c43896a6b7ff0e55f72dd7ffce02487ac7299e
Closes-Bug: #1567439
(cherry picked from commit 1eb65cc189ccc2125c9845d025aec937d2a56ab4)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-28 06:16:02.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/base_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/vmware_attributes.json', 'nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer.py'], 'message': "Allow user upload CA bundle file for Glance with VMware backend

Add field that allows user to upload CA certificate that emitted
vCenters TLS/SSL certificate. It allow Glance with VMware backend verify
connection to vCenter server (verification is turned on by default).
If user did not uploaded certificate then, glance will be configured
to skip verification step during connection to vCenter.

Partial-bug: #1559067

Change-Id: I810bc000e54b941018a1190acb26d33150b74ce0
(cherry picked from commit 59c8b8c7909de07bcbb97ec6c9ae509f98bdaff2)

commit_message:
Allow user upload CA bundle file for Glance with VMware backend

Add field that allows user to upload CA certificate that emitted
vCenters TLS/SSL certificate. It allow Glance with VMware backend verify
connection to vCenter server (verification is turned on by default).
If user did not uploaded certificate then, glance will be configured
to skip verification step during connection to vCenter.

Partial-bug: #1559067
DocImpact: Document how to use 'CA file' field on VMware tab.
Change-Id: I810bc000e54b941018a1190acb26d33150b74ce0
(cherry picked from commit 59c8b8c7909de07bcbb97ec6c9ae509f98bdaff2)

commit_message:
Check connectivity from instance with DPDK via floating IP

Scenario:
1. Create a new security group (if it doesn`t exist yet).
2. Create router
3. Create network
4. Create subnet
5. Uplink subnet to router.
6. Create new flavor with huge pages
7. Create an instance using the new flavor, security group
in created subnet. Boot it on compute with enabled DPDK.
8. Create a new floating IP
9. Assign the new floating IP to the instance.
10. Check connectivity to the floating IP using ping command.
11. Check that public IP 8.8.8.8 can be pinged from instance.
12. Disassociate server floating ip.
13. Delete floating ip
14. Delete server.
15. Delete flavor
16. Remove router.
17. Remove subnet
18. Remove network

Change-Id: I86c43896a6b7ff0e55f72dd7ffce02487ac7299e
Closes-Bug: #1567439

commit_message:
Change provisioning method to 'image' for 8.0

The only supported method to provision environment in versions past
7.0 (including 8.0, 9.0 and so on) is 'image' for image-based
provisioning.

Update the value of the corresponding parameter to be compatible
to releases in question.

Closes-bug: 1573100
Change-Id: I8397f2460539a503884fd813f484dd78df8e352f
(cherry picked from commit 5cbf3f7c2e5a33705f2dcc5c6a6152cf12dd87c0)

commit_message:
Fix invalid uuid warnings in compute api testcases

Currently, unit testcases of compute api emit FutureWarnings
from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

Fake constants are defined for project_id and user_id as they
are used without '-' at keystone side.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Partial-Bug: #1557378
Change-Id: I71ae53edd183a9d7d80f6cf1b6bb23902f5c6f35
